tmf
[Groovy] Class Ls

java.lang.Object
  tmf.Sn
      tmf.Ls

@InheritConstructors
class Ls
extends Sn

A Language Section is the part of a Terminological Entry containing information related to one language. It is described in ISO 16642. Note: One Terminological Entry may contain information on one or two languages.

Authors:
Stephane Aubry
See Also:
Iu

Te

private List TovaNamesForLs

tovaNamesForLs is the list of Transitive OVerwritable Attributes names applicable to the current Language Section object.

Field Detail

TovaNamesForLs

private List TovaNamesForLs
tovaNamesForLs is the list of Transitive OVerwritable Attributes names applicable to the current Language Section object. It is a subset of tovaNames of Tdc class.
See Also:
Tdc.tovaNames

Ls

Method Detail

populate

def populate(Node node, Map tovas, LsMode lsMode)
Fills the Language Section with data read from the Freeplane node. Details of the created Information Units:
  • objectLanguage
    Note: if the parent Terminological Entry is bilingual, objectLanguage is set to either sourceLanguage or targetLanguage value.
Details of the created Term Sections: One Term Section is created.
Parameters:
node - The node of the Terminological Entry in the Freeplane map.
tovas - The map node of Transitive OVerwritable Attributes. Keys of the map entries are attribute names.
lsMode - The type of Language Section to be populated. See Constants.LsMode
See Also:
Iu
Ls

toGmt

def toGmt(MarkupBuilder xml)
Outputs the Language Section in an XML format. The format is named GMT (Generic Mapping Tool) and is specified in ISO 16642. The Language Section is transformed into an XML element named struct with the XML attribute type = "LS".
Parameters:
xml - MarkupBuilder
